entry.title: SIGHASH_WITHINPUTVALUE
entry.summary: In an email exchange on January 23, 2015, Alan Reiner discussed the implementation of a new SIGHASH type that would enable devices like Trezor to simplify their design while still maintaining security. While he initially stated that it was the only way to achieve this goal, he later corrected himself, stating that it was simply the easiest and least-intrusive way to do so.
